title: Requirements
context: High-level requirements for a specific Teams Tab App solution like availability, latency, expected no. of users etc.

children.title: How many users are expected to use the solution?
children.context: The number of expected hourly, daily, monthly users is a good indicator for later requirements in regards to scalability and others.

children.title: Is the solution accessed from users in a specific geographic region?
children.context: Solutions with users from various geographical regions have other requirements in regards to latency and availability.
children.recommendation: Solutions with users from different geographical regions should leverage multi-region deployments and global load balancers like Azure Front Door or Traffic Manager to distribute load across different regional deployments for latency and failover purposes.

children.title: Is the solution backend hosted on a cloud platform like Azure?
children.context: Cloud platforms like Microsoft Azure offer certain capabilities like auto scaling and data center regions across the globe that might not be available on-premises.

children.title: Does the solution have dependencies to any on-premises systems?
children.context: Solutions with dependencies to on-premises systems might have specific requirements in regards to connectivity via e.g. VPN or Express Route.

title: Is the current solution able to scale?
context: Scalability is a key aspect to fulfill increasing usage while maintaining a consistent user experience.
recommendation: Teams Apps should be designed from the beginning to be able to scale in and out easily based on changing demand.

children.title: Is the solution separated into separate components that can scale individually?
children.context: Separate components of an application might have different requirements in regards to scalability, state and lifecycle.
children.recommendation: Separate larger solutions into smaller, microservice-like components that can scale individually.

children.title: If the solution requires authentication, integrate Microsoft single sign-on (SSO) for a seamless sign-in experience.

title: How is the solution and its components monitored?

children.title: Are critical system flows within the solution monitored?
Are response times monitored?
children.context: If a response to an action takes more than three seconds, you must provide a loading message or warning.
children.recommendation: Make sure that the app displays a loading indicator or some form of warning when something is taking longer than expected to respond.

title: How are changes and features rolled out?

children.title: Is there a separation between dev/test and prod?
Are new releases versioned and tested before they're rolled out to production?
Where are changes to the Teams Tab app tested?
children.context: Microsoft Teams apps can be debugged Purely local, Locally hosted in Teams or Cloud-hosted in Teams. See [Choosing a setup to test and debug your Microsoft Teams app](https://docs.microsoft.com/microsoftteams/platform/concepts/build-and-test/debug) for more.
